p: Extensive evidence from the WA climate health public inquiry expresses significant concerns about the mental health impacts of climate change. 2 , 6 In particular, children and young people have ‘high levels of concern and anxiety about climate change and what their future will look like’. 2 Indeed, in the 2019 survey of 15 703 Australians aged 18–29 by youth radio station Triple J, 43% of respondents said climate change was the number one issue affecting their generation, while 22% of respondents identified mental health. 7
